metadata.title: CVE-2014-3504 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The (1) serf_ssl_cert_issuer, (2) serf_ssl_cert_subject, and (3)serf_ssl_cert_certificate functions in Serf 0.2.0 through 1.3.x before1.3.7 does not properly handle a NUL byte in a domain name in the subject'sCommon Name (CN) field of an X.509 certificate, which allowsman-in-the-middle attackers to spoof arbitrary SSL servers via a craftedcertificate issued by a legitimate Certification Authority.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libserf-1-1 - 1.3.3-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: serf package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.3-1ubuntu0.1').
